snippet: A battle over media censorship intensified Monday with an outpouring of support for journalists at a newspaper who are protesting what they called overbearing censorship by Chinese officials.
abstract: Hundreds of demonstrators gather outside southern China headquarters of newspaper Southern Weekend in support of journalists upset by what they claim is overbearing interference by local propaganda officials; protest intensifies battle over media censorship that poses test of willingness of China's new leadership to tolerate calls for change.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing. Mia Li contributed research from Guangzhou, China, and Shi Da from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: A battle over media censorship intensified Monday with an outpouring of support for journalists at a newspaper who are protesting what they called overbearing censorship by Chinese officials.

headline.seo: Supporters Back Strike at Newspaper in China
headline.main: Protest Grows Over Censoring of China Paper
headline.print_headline: Protest Grows Over Censoring Of China Paper
